result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: For conditions, see Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.dispoDesc:
Dismissed with Prejudice
Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the DPA

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lena L. Livermore-Faber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /s/ TBE 11/02/16 - Dismissed with Prejudice; Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the DPA

Amended 11/4/2015 to remove the no alcohol condition.  
No abusive contact with John Bermen.

Defendant Lena L. Livermore-Faber in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:54 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  DPA recommended for 12 months.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD entry of the Judgment of Conviction.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court re: victim.  No restitution is being requested.  State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  The victim is not present. 
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court.  Asks that the no alcohol condition of bond be modified. 
 
BY THE COURT:  
Court does agree the DPA is appropriate and approves as submitted, signs the agreement with today's date. 
Court grants the request to drop the no alcohol condition of bond.

10:43 a.m. Defendant Lena L. Livermore-Faber in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties jointly request matter be rescheduled after 10-22-15.  DPA assessment still needs to be done. BTC: granted
  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lena L. Livermore-Faber
Current: 5369 Prairie Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2015)
Prior: 7057 6th Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

$500 cash bond (already posted):   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  No abusive contact with John Bermen  .

Defendant Lena L. Livermore-Faber in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
BTC: $500 cash bond (already posted):   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  No abusive contact with John Bermen  .  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
